page.title: 06RELIGIOUS SEVERN STOKE
page.content: The church of{St. Denys}in Severn Stoke (C of E) was built by the Saxons and lies in the diocese of Kempsey.In 1886 the river Severn rose three feet into the church making this one of only two churches in the U.K. which has been subject to flooding.The vicar of Severn Stoke lives in Kempsey and is responsible for two other parishes as well.The congregation numbers fifty to one hundred people, with services held regularly on Sundays and occasionally on weekdays. The{Hare Krshna}movement owned the Croombe Court Estate for a time and worked the estate's land as a co-operative farm.However, they kept themselves very much to themselves and did not have much influence on the surrounding villages.
